title: Developer in Residence (Contractor)
content:
About Elemental Excelerator
Elemental Excelerator is on a mission to redesign the systems at the root of climate change. We are a leading nonprofit investor focused on scaling climate solutions and social impact for all communities. Elemental fills two fundamental gaps in tackling climate change: funding first-of-a-kind (FOAK) projects for climate technologies in real communities, and embedding equity and access into climate solutions.
As a nonprofit with over a decade of experience in scaling technologies, we are uniquely positioned to provide much-needed support and services to overcome the valleys of death to scale the technologies we need to address the climate crisis. We do more than simply write a check; we offer a full suite of hands-on services, support, coaching and mentorship, and introductions across the value stream to support growth and deployments. The organization has stood up a half-dozen programs to break down barriers to climate tech innovation through its robust portfolio, policy, equity & access, career pathways, investors/philanthropy, and strategic partnerships.
Apply to be an Elemental Coach! 
This is a consulting position that could range from 2-10 hours per week with some variability on a seasonal basis. Additional hours may be required for resource development. Work will be performed within a dynamic, entrepreneurial team environment with support from our organization, roster of existing coaches and industry partners. We are looking for someone who is a delight to work with, can begin with the nuance of implementing complex issues in a startup environment, and can be a diligent partner for our entrepreneurs!
About the role
Through our years of experience funding and supporting companies across our portfolio, we’ve found significant support gaps in how companies scale from real-world demonstration to commercial scale. To help address this, Elemental is committed to providing catalytic funding for projects with deep environmental and community impact and building new support models for companies such as project finance, policy and permitting, community engagement, sales, engineering, procurement and construction, and more (read more on our strategy here) – that’s where you come in.
Elemental is seeking a Developer in Residence to join our team and support our portfolio of climate tech entrepreneurs as they navigate the complexities of deploying a first-of-a-kind (FOAK) or early commercial climate tech project. In addition to bringing your expertise as a project developer to 1:1 and group work with our portfolio companies, you will serve as a thought partner to Elemental as we work to develop and build out more support offerings for our portfolio, including a roster of specialized project developers to support their journey. 
Key responsibilities may include:                         
Coaching Services

1:1 coaching hours to advise Elemental portfolio companies as they build capacity to navigate sophisticated project development topics, such as how to:

Identify project opportunities and objectives, assess feasibility and risk, and develop comprehensive project plans with clear budgets, milestones, and timelines
Navigate site selection, land purchases, and permitting
Effectively engage and manage project stakeholders, including engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) firms, equipment manufacturers and tech providers, suppliers, offtake, insurance providers, and community partners

Design and host interactive workshops for Elemental portfolio companies and facilitate peer-to-peer learning sessions

Thought Partner and Capacity Building

Own the design and implementation of new services to support portfolio companies looking to successfully and equitably deploy FOAK climate tech projects
Develop and share a suite of tools, resource guides, and processes for Elemental to best support portfolio companies’ unique needs and challenges
Share progress and insights and serve as an extension of the Elemental team
Attend team meetings and in-person events as needed

About you
You could be a great addition to our team if you are a highly motivated and experienced project developer who is passionate about supporting entrepreneurs who work at the intersection of climate and social equity. We are looking for someone who is keen to contribute at a strategic level, while effectively supporting companies with their unique needs.
Qualifications - even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we still encourage you to apply!          
Desired skills:                              

Significant experience as a project developer where responsibilities spanned site selection, permitting, community engagement, procurement, EPC contract negotiations, etc. Experience negotiating off-take agreements is a plus.
Experience coaching or providing consulting services.
Comfortability in creating effective processes, curriculum, and deliverables to support mentees as they drive toward inflection points.
Relevant network of project developers, EPC firms, etc. across the US and internationally and ability to engage said network to support the needs of Elemental portfolio companies and the broader ecosystem. Project finance relationships are a plus.
Interest in and experience with emerging technologies in one or more of the following sector(s): energy, mobility, water, agriculture, or industry.
High emotional intelligence and ability to build interpersonal relationships.

Location
This position will be remote and candidates can be based anywhere in the United States.
Compensation 

The starting hourly rate for this opportunity is $150/hr.
Continuation of employment is dependent upon program/operational needs, satisfactory work performance, availability of funds, and compliance with applicable Federal/State laws.

Other Details
We will accept and review applications on a rolling basis. Although all applications will be considered, we may be unable to respond to all inquiries. Please note that we do read cover letters, so we advise spending adequate time on them to share your relevant stories and experiences with us. We also ask that you refrain from using tools like Chat GPT and keep the cover letter to 1-2 pages long. 
Elemental Excelerator is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and has a strong commitment to diversity. Candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Candidates from the following groups are especially encouraged to apply: Black, Indigenous, and people of color (BIPOC); members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer or questioning, intersex, asexual (LGBTQIA+) communities; people who have disabilities; people from low-income backgrounds; people who identify as nonbinary; and women.
Elemental is also committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its services, activities, programs, and employment opportunities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and other applicable laws.

offices.name: Bloomhouse HQ
offices.location: East Palo Alto, California, United States

demographic_questions.description:
Aloha,  

 

At Elemental, having a diverse organization that reflects the communities we partner with and serve is paramount to our mission to redesign systems at the root of our climate crisis. In order to increase representation across identity groups, we are collecting information regarding age, race/ethnicity, gender, and sexual orientation. We recognize these are not the only identities and are starting here as they are often the most salient for people in the workforce. Additionally, we want to make sure that all candidates receive fair treatment and have an equitable experience during the hiring process. Collecting demographic data will help us to identify trends and enhance the candidate experience. 

 

This survey is completely optional. Submitting information is 100% your choice. If you decide to share information with us, it will only be used to evaluate and support our Equity & Access efforts. Rest assured, this survey will have no influence on your application, interview process, or ultimately, hiring decision.  If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to us at Hiring@elementalexcelerator.com.
